name: Yellowstone National Park
subtitle: Wyoming, Montana, idaho
details: Yellowstone National Park is America's first national park. It spans 2.2 million acres across Wyoming, Montana, and idaho, featuring geysers, hot springs, and diverse wildlife including bison, bears, and wolves.

name: Grand Canyon National Park
subtitle: Arizona
details: The Grand Canyon is one of the world's most spectacular natural wonders. Carved by the Colorado River over millions of years, it reveals nearly 2 billion years of Earth's geological history.

name: Yosemite National Park
subtitle: California
details: Yosemite is renowned for its granite cliffs, waterfalls, clear streams, and giant sequoia groves. It's home to iconic landmarks like Half Dome and El Capitan.

name: Great Smoky Mountains National Park
subtitle: Tennessee, North Carolina
details: The Great Smoky Mountains National Park is the most visited national park in America. It features ancient mountains, diverse wildlife, and preserved Southern Appalachian mountain culture.

name: Zion National Park
subtitle: Utah
details: Zion National Park is known for its dramatic red cliffs and narrow slot canyons. The Virgin River has carved deep canyons through the red and tan colored Navajo Sandstone.

name: Acadia National Park
subtitle: Maine
details: Acadia National Park protects the natural beauty of the highest rocky headlands along the Atlantic coastline of the United States. It features rugged coastlines, pristine lakes, and forested mountains.

name: Rocky Mountain National Park
subtitle: Colorado
details: Rocky Mountain National Park features majestic mountain views, diverse wildlife, and 300 miles of hiking trails. The park's high altitude provides spectacular alpine scenery.

name: Glacier National Park
subtitle: Montana
details: Glacier National Park is known as the 'Crown of the Continent' due to its pristine ecosystems. It features dramatic peaks, glacial-carved valleys, and over 700 lakes.
